qas.question: What is a name for the reduced complement of genetic material necessary for an organism to live?
In what experimental contexts are experiments being carried out on minimal genomes?

plausible_answers.text: to reduce the number of genes in a genome to the bare minimum

qas.question: What is a research strategy to understand silico?
What is being done on single cell silico?
In what two ways are experiments being carried out to understand how genes survive?
What do scientists want a silico to do in the experiment?
What are scientists studying to understand how they survive a reduction in silico?

context: Since genomes are very complex, one research strategy is <b2_0>to reduce the number of genes in a genome to the bare minimum<b2_0/> and still have the organism in question <b5_0>survive<b5_0/>. There is <b3_0>experimental work<b3_0/> being done on <a0_0>minimal <b6_0>genomes<b6_0/><a0_0/> for single cell organisms as well as minimal genomes for multi-cellular organisms (see Developmental biology). The work is both <a1_0><b4_0>in vivo and in silico<b4_0/><a1_0/>.
